name: rephotograph
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to take a photograph of someone or something again: She found some old family photos and then rephotographed the same people in the same locations. They plan to re-photograph the ever-changing landscape every five years.
More examplesFewer examplesI don't re-photograph most people but I keep re-photographing myself because I have to do a lot of test-shots.They rephotograph great photographic works to challenge the idea of the unique genius of the artist-photographer.He decided to rephotograph as many of the town's residents as he could find.
